alert.note: Alert for Barbour (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 4:16PM CDT until June 14 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Barbour County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 530 PM CDT. * At 416 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Barbour County Public Lake Dam, or 8 miles southeast of Midway, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Eufaula, Clayton, Louisville, Hawkinsville, Spring Hill, Gaino, Comer, Barbour County Public Lake Dam, Osco, Texasville, Richards Crossroads, White Oak, Lakepoint Resort State Park, Boot Hill, Millers Ford, Batesville, Clayton Municipal Airport, Twin Springs, Lugo and Baker Hill. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
